item.title: Nominations for EPA Region 4 Rain Catcher Award-Deadline is March 15, 2017
item.description: ATLANTA – For the fourth consecutive year, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is accepting nominations for the Rain Catcher Awards for excellence in implementation of stormwater green infrastructure projects during the past year.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Awards $1.8 Million to the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill to Assist Small Drinking Water and Wastewater Systems
item.description: ATLANTA – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is awarding a $1.8 million grant to the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill to improve the financial and managerial capabilities of small public water systems across the country.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: Public Comment Period Now Open for EPA and DOJ Settlement to Conduct Interim Cleanup of CTS Site in Asheville, N.C.

item.title: EPA Awards $100K to Rocky Mount, N.C., Small Business to Develop a Cleaner, More Efficient Cookstove
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA and DOJ Reach $9 Million Settlement for Interim Cleanup of CTS Site in Asheville, N.C.

item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA, NC DEQ, and Multistate Trust to Hold Public Meeting about Kerr-McGee Superfund Site in Navassa, North Carolina, Dec. 7, 2016
item.description: ATLANTA – Federal and state officials and Multistate Trust representatives will host a public information session on Dec. 7, 2016 to update residents about the ongoing environmental investigation and upcoming work at the Kerr-McGee Chemical Corporation Superfund Site (Site).
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Awards $120,000 to Cape Fear River Watch, Inc. to Reduce Risks to Subsistence Fishers in New Hanover and Pender Counties in North Carolina
item.description: ATLANTA – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) announced Cape Fear River Watch, Inc. is among 10 community-based organizations selected nationally to receive competitive cooperative agreements to address environmental justice issues.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Announces $5.5 Million Settlement for Cleanup of Ward Transformer Superfund Site in Raleigh, N.C.
item.description: ATLANTA – Today, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) announced a settlement with 173 parties to clean areas surrounding the Ward Transformer Superfund Site (Site) in Raleigh, N.C.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: Officials Announce Permanent Clean Drinking Water System for Residents of Durham Community
item.description: ATLANTA – Residents of a Durham County community now have a permanent source of clean drinking water, thanks to the work of state, federal and local officials.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Awards North Carolina State University Funding to Research Water Quality Benefits
item.dc:creator: Region 04
